name: Wakanda
description: A mythical African nation known for its advanced technology and rich culture.

name: Victoria Falls
description: One of the largest and most famous waterfalls in the world, located on the Zambezi River.

name: Table Mountain
description: A flat-topped mountain forming a prominent landmark overlooking the city of Cape Town.

name: Pyramids of Giza
description: Ancient pyramids and the Sphinx, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.

name: Serengeti National Park
description: Famous for its annual migration of over 1.5 million wildebeest and hundreds of thousands of zebras.

name: Marrakech Medina
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site with vibrant souks, palaces, and gardens.

name: Mount Kilimanjaro
description: Africa's highest peak and a popular destination for climbers and adventurers.

name: Sossusvlei Dunes
description: Iconic red sand dunes in the heart of the Namib Desert.

name: Robben Island
description: Historic island where Nelson Mandela was imprisoned for 18 years.

name: Ngorongoro Crater
description: A large volcanic caldera and a haven for wildlife.

name: Bazaruto Archipelago
description: A group of islands known for their white-sand beaches and marine life.

name: Karnak Temple
description: A vast complex of decayed temples, chapels, and pylons.

name: Okavango Delta
description: A unique inland delta and a UNESCO World Heritage site.

name: Lalibela Rock-Hewn Churches
description: Famous for its monolithic churches carved out of rock.

name: Zanzibar Stone Town
description: A historic town with winding alleys, bustling bazaars, and mosques.

name: Sahara Desert
description: The world's largest hot desert, stretching across several countries.

name: Cape Coast Castle
description: A historic slave trade castle and UNESCO World Heritage site.

name: Fish River Canyon
description: Africa's largest canyon, offering breathtaking views and hiking trails.

name: Djenne Mosque
description: The largest mud-brick building in the world and a UNESCO World Heritage site.

name: Bwindi Impenetrable Forest
description: A biodiverse, mountainous area known for its population of mountain gorillas.

name: Gor√©e Island
description: A small island with a dark history as a slave-trading center.

name: Kakum National Park
description: Famous for its canopy walkway above the rainforest.

name: Blyde River Canyon
description: One of the largest canyons on Earth, known for its lush subtropical foliage.

name: Lake Malawi
description: A vast lake with clear waters, sandy beaches, and diverse fish species.

name: Sidi Bou Said
description: A picturesque town known for its blue and white architecture.

name: Addis Ababa National Museum
description: Home to the famous fossil 'Lucy' and other archaeological treasures.

name: Elmina Castle
description: A historic castle and former slave trading post.

name: Mount Kenya National Park
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site with Africa's second highest peak.

name: Giza Solar Boat Museum
description: Museum housing the reconstructed Khufu ship, an ancient Egyptian vessel.

name: Kairouan Mosque
description: One of the most important mosques in North Africa.

name: Kruger National Park
description: One of Africa's largest game reserves, home to the Big Five.

name: Fes el Bali
description: A medieval city with narrow alleys and ancient mosques.

name: Lake Retba (Lac Rose)
description: A pink-colored lake due to its high salt content and algae.

name: Sphinx Observatory
description: A site near the Sphinx offering panoramic views of the pyramids.

name: Atlas Mountains
description: A mountain range stretching across northwestern Africa.

name: Gebel Barkal
description: A small mountain and archaeological site with ancient temples.

name: Kigali Genocide Memorial
description: A memorial and museum commemorating the victims of the 1994 genocide.

name: Sainte Anne Marine National Park
description: A marine park with coral reefs and diverse marine life.

name: Royal Palace of Rabat
description: The official residence of the King of Morocco.

name: Djoudj National Bird Sanctuary
description: A wetland reserve and UNESCO World Heritage site, home to millions of birds.

name: Mosi-oa-Tunya National Park
description: A national park that includes part of Victoria Falls.
